Articles.Content:
I'm playing career mode and Jeb made it safely onto to the Mun and did some science. (Yay!) But he wasted too much fuel landing, so he couldn't get back. (Boo!) I got him into a stable Munar orbit and sent an unmanned rescue rocket for him. A dicey 500m spacewalk later, he was on board Rescue I and (barely) got back home.(Yay!) But the science he did, except for some "personal" reports (EVA) didn't recover. (Boo!) I assume they are still on the original capsule. Is there any way to remove stored science from the command pod and take it home? Or should I just forget it and try a new Mun mission with better Delta V planning?

Edited March 11, 2014 by bighara
If you right click on the capsule after starting your EVA, you should be able to select an option something like "Take stored experiments" or something similar.
Right click the science experiments and capsules while in EVA to remove the data

Right click the science experiments and capsules while in EVA to remove the data

I did remove the data from the experiments while on the surface. So if I go back to the abandoned capsule, I can right-click it and gather the science?
So, with other words, you've could bring them back with Jeb while he was rescued. Now you need another Mission.
Argh! OK, thanks. I'll have to decide if it's worth it.

You'll need a mission to recover the old data. Rendezvous with the old craft, EVA over, take the data out of the old capsule and any experiments, and EVA back to the new mission.

Then if you like you could land the new mission in a different biome for more science, or just head back to Kerbin.

I'd say go for the recovery, it'll give you some good rendezvous and EVA practice.

Edited March 9, 2014 by cantab

You'd have to fly a rendezvous in Mun orbit, and if the original ship didn't have a docking ring, you'd have to have a Kerbal ferry data back and forth while constantly fiddling with RCS to keep the ships from drifting too far apart. All things considered, it would be much easier to forget about that ship and fly the whole mission over again with a craft that has the range to make the roundtrip.

A two-kerbal mission, or a manned mission with probe core backup, would work well for that. Get to maybe 50m away and dead stop, EVA over, if there's too much drift board the craft and see where it went, fix position if need be, EVA back.

The fun part is if you can turn your EVA mission into a debris deorbit mission...

On a similar note, I have a Minmus mission that ran out of electricity so Jeb is stuck on the surface. I was going to gather the stored science out of the capsule, but I don't see the option to remove it, only to store. He's EVA, but not in flight. Would that make a difference?
Sure that doesn't mean you've already got the science out?
I guess I could try re-storing it and see. But I didn't think I'd done anything to remove it yet.
You should be able to review all the data a kerbal is carrying by opening his menu and selecting the relevant option.
